text: {{Infobox settlement |name = Shida Kartli |native_name = შიდა ქართლი |native_name_lang = ka |settlement_type = Mkhare (region) |image_map = Shida Kartli in Georgia (disputed hatched).svg |mapsize = 280px |map_caption = Overlapping borders of Shida Kartli region and South Ossetia |subdivision_type = Country |subdivision_name = |seat = Gori | parts_type = Municipalities | parts_style = para | parts = | p1 = 5 |leader_title = Governor |leader_name = Giorgi Khojevanishvili |area_total_km2 = 5729 |population_total = 263382 |population_as_of = 2014 census |population_density_km2 = auto |timezone = Georgian Time |utc_offset = +4 |time_zone_DST = |utc_offset_DST = |iso_code = GE-SK |footnotes = Without Russian occupied part of Shida Kartli. }} Shida Kartli is a region in Georgia. The capital city is Gori. Part of the region is under South Ossetian control. It is in a lowland between the Greater and Lesser Caucasus. The Ksani River is in the east. Shida Kartli is divided into 5 municipalities. The municipalities are: *Gori (Partly in South Ossetia) *Kaspi *Kareli (Partly in South Ossetia) *Khashuri *Eredvi (in South Ossetia) ==References== Category:Regions of Georgia (country) Category:South Ossetia
title: Shida Kartli
